abstract.text: Sensors that can log data to onboard storage adhere to this protocol
to configure, start, stop, and download the logger.

Unless you construct your own sensor wrappers, this protocol’s details
and default methods are unlikely to be important to you.

abstract.text: XYZ (Gs)
Sensors natively incapable of continuous output, such as thermistors,
can output “streamable” and loggable outputs with the help of
onboard timers that fire at reasonable intervals. This protocol
organizes the methods and properties for polling such sensors.
Issues a command that returns a value.
Develop Bluetooth Low Energy apps using our sensors and
WXYZ
Identifier for downloadable logger signal when exporting an
Detect when there is no motion for a certain amount of time.
Commands to start the data signal.
The BMI270 can detect motions including walking, biking, sitting in a moving car, coach or train, etc.
Situations that don’t typically trigger include phone in pocket while stationary or
phone at rest on a table which is in normal office use.
Sensors that can stream data at about 100 to 120 Hz
adhere to this protocol to configure, start, and stop a
data signal.
Sensors that can log data to onboard storage adhere to this protocol
to configure, start, stop, and download the logger.
Specify event frequencies in Hz or millisecond periods between events
Publishes if connected and setup at start, failing if not.
Tracks step counts, reporting the current count every ~20 steps
The BMI270 can detect simple user activities (unknown, still, walking, running)
and send an interrupt if those are changed, e.g. from walking to running.
The BMI270 uses the slope between two acceleration signals to detect changes in motion.
Emits steps detected in 20 step intervals.
Reports steps one by one (e.g., you can react to them or sum all the “1”s you receive)
Commands to customize the logger.
Commands after unsubscribing from the logger signal.
Lux (Illuminance)
Issues a command, such as recording a macro or resetting to factory defaults.

For signals that can only be read once
Sensors natively incapable of continuous output, such as thermistors,
adopt this protocol to organize configuring, reading, and closing a
sensor’s data signal.

parameters are nil, the device uses the
